title: Central Decatur Community School District
text:
Central Decatur Community School District is a rural <a href="state%20school">public</a> <a href="school%20district">school district</a> for <a href="Decatur%20County%2C%20Iowa">Decatur County</a>, Iowa, headquartered in the community of <a href="Leon%2C%20Iowa">Leon, Iowa</a>. The district contains students from <a href="Decatur%20City%2C%20Iowa">Decatur City</a>, <a href="Grand%20River%2C%20Iowa">Grand River</a>, <a href="Davis%20City%2C%20Iowa">Davis City</a>, and <a href="Pleasanton%2C%20Iowa">Pleasanton</a>. The district covers over 60% of Decatur County.
The average ACT score is 25 and over 95% of all students graduate high school. The colors are red and white, and the mascot is a <a href="Cardinal%20%28bird%29">cardinal</a>.
District Administration.
Superintendent of Schools<br>
Chris Coffelt
Schools.
The district operates three schools, all in Leon:
South Elementary School "grades pre-k through 2nd"<br> 
201 SE 6th Street
North Elementary School "grades 3rd through 6th"<br>
1203 NE Poplar Street
Junior-Senior High School "grades 7th through 12th"<br>
1201 NE Poplar Street
Central Decatur Junior-Senior High School.
Athletics.
The Cardinals compete in the <a href="Pride%20of%20Iowa%20Conference">Pride of Iowa Conference</a>.
Central Decatur fields teams in <a href="American%20football">football</a>, cross country, wrestling (with <a href="Lenox%20Community%20School%20District">Lenox</a>), boys and girls <a href="basketball">basketball</a>, bowling, <a href="golf">golf</a>, track and field, <a href="baseball">baseball</a>, and <a href="softball">softball</a>.
